shipBlueprint.name: MU_SAMMY_CRUISER
shipBlueprint.class: Sammy The Spider's Super Spider Spaceship (tm)

shipBlueprint.name: DEFAULT
shipBlueprint.class: THIS IS A BUG. REPORT IT ALONG WITH THE EVENT AND SECTOR.

shipBlueprint.name: Superluminal
shipBlueprint.desc: An iconic Kestrel-model cruiser, this vessel is well rounded and well suited to both experienced and inexperienced captains.

shipBlueprint.name: SW Moorcock
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Kestrel Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A modified Federation cruiser which is armed with a Laser Artillery system and decent weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: Superposition
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Federation Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: When outfitting various Federation owned cruisers with Multiverse travel, the Stealth cruiser was decided to be an optimal choice because of its speed and well... stealthiness.

shipBlueprint.name: Brane
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Stealth Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Harmony has taken interest in creating one collective consciousness across dimensions, and ships like these are tasked in defending it.

shipBlueprint.name: Tegmark 4
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Harmony Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A refurbished Union cruiser adapted for multiversal travel, outfitted with crew determined to defend against the odds found on the way.

shipBlueprint.name: Anthropia
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Union Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Crystalline vessel was one of the intrepid few to leave behind the crystalline origins and journey off into the Multiverse.

shipBlueprint.name: CSMLG Horizons
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Imperial Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A not-so-traditional boarding vessel that will force you to use tactics you might not be accustomed to.

shipBlueprint.name: Occam's Razor
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Spectral Multiverse Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A strange vessel from another far distant reality, carrying a strange Lanius crew from a distant land, and some powerful ancient tech.

shipBlueprint.name: Origin
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel the universes and unlock all of the page 1 Multiverse cruisers to unlock the first Federation Multiverse vessel.
shipBlueprint.desc: The original Multiverse cruiser, though it has been through quite a lot in its travels.

shipBlueprint.name: Last Bastion
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 8 with the Proto-MV Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A modified MV Cruiser outfitted to survive even the harshest of conditions.

shipBlueprint.name: Cosmic Drifter
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defeat the Flagship with the Proto-MV Cruiser Type B to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A refurbished and improved version of the Proto-MV Cruiser with an additional impulse drive that allows it to escape combat. However due to instabilities caused by the augment, unexpected technical failures may begin to occur if too much hull damage is sustained.

shipBlueprint.name: Ultimatum Sapius
shipBlueprint.unlock: The data on how to unlock this vessel is unknown.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Rebellion's super-weapon, captured and reverse-engineered by Federation recovery teams. With a few minor refurbishings, this ship is still very powerful, but does not support systems it doesn't start with.

shipBlueprint.name: Ultimatum Sapius II
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type A.
shipBlueprint.desc: The next stage of the Flagship, more damaged and missing an artillery but now with a heavier focus on drones.

shipBlueprint.name: Ultimatum Sapius III
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type B.
shipBlueprint.desc: The final stage of the Flagship, heavily damaged but still very deadly.

shipBlueprint.name: Laissez Faire
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defeat the Flagship using any Multiverse Cruiser or Proto-MV Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A standard cruiser typically meant for civilian use, outfitted with standard weaponry and plenty of room for crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Mihintale
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Union Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A reoutfitted medical transport, which confusingly comes with no additional medical utilities and must rely on its crew instead.

shipBlueprint.name: Zacchaeus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Union Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Union Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A former mercantile vessel, although its owner was killed by Mantis warlords. The Federation was able to salvage the ship and its merchant beacon.

shipBlueprint.name: Cadwalader
shipBlueprint.unlock: Meet up with the famous detective Haynes and save the Militia from a Rebel attack to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Union Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This massive cruiser is the forefront of the Militia's arsenal. Well armed and staffed, it's far better than you'd expect for a civilian militia to pull together.

shipBlueprint.name: Ge-Devol-54
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Militia Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A specialized militia cruiser that eliminates the enemy through boarding techniques without actually risking their civilian crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Rosenberg
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Militia Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Militia Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A special ops Militia cruiser assisted by some extra elite manpower. With advanced stealth technology, the enemies won't even see this ship coming.

shipBlueprint.name: The Kestrel
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help an old-Earth collector recover a stolen antique to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Militia Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: A boring and outdated human vessel originally produced by the Federation. These ships are suddenly much more popular with the boom of Multiverse travel.

shipBlueprint.name: The Egret
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Kestrel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship was designed by a laser aficionado who looked at the old Red-Tail and said 'I can do that better'. This design is even faster firing, but lacks ability to damage systems.

shipBlueprint.name: Bird of Prey
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Kestrel Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Kestrel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This boarding vessel comes only with human crew, but is able to protect itself adequately while in combat.

shipBlueprint.name: The Osprey
shipBlueprint.unlock: Put a stop to a Rebel raid in Federation space to earn the trust of Vice Admiral Adara and unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Kestrel Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is equipped with a powerful Artillery Beam that tears through enemy ships.

shipBlueprint.name: Haliaeetus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Federation Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship was created by a crazed pirate obsessed with the piece of tech loved by no other creature - Mine Launchers.

shipBlueprint.name: The Phoenix
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Federation Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Federation Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is armed with a deadly fire-based Artillery Beam.

shipBlueprint.name: The Nesasio
shipBlueprint.unlock: Recover stolen blueprints from a Mantis envoy to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Federation Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: An advanced stealth cruiser built for speed and evasion over high offensive power.

shipBlueprint.name: Schwerer Gustav
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Stealth Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A stealth ship wielding only a single Beam weapon that gets stronger with every time you fire it.

shipBlueprint.name: Skojare
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Stealth Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Stealth Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship specializes in manipulating the enemy ship while it stays hidden with its Cloaking system.

shipBlueprint.name: Curiosity
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help recover this lost ship from a dangerous sector to unlock it... OR win the game with any Stealth Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Federation's AI program is far less advanced than the Rebels', and this ship can only automatically man its pilot and sensor systems. Though its original purpose was unsupervised long-term exploration in deep space, its impressive sensor array also makes it a formidable combatant.

shipBlueprint.name: Zhurong
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Federation Auto-Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Multiversal War has necessitated that many Federation vessels which were designed for other purposes be retrofitted for battle. With both stealth and counter-stealth capabilities, this ship excels in search-and-destroy missions.

shipBlueprint.name: Pragyan
shipBlueprint.desc: This Auto-Cruiser has been tasked with the search and study of unusual new life-forms. It serves as a refuge for beings who have no other home.

shipBlueprint.name: The Equinox
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help a disgruntled former employee get her revenge on her old employers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The iconic cruiser of Ellie the Equinoid in the well known Union show 'Ellie the Equinoid', starring Ellie the Equinoid.

shipBlueprint.name: The Nightmare
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has a particularly vulnerable set of crew that must rely on their force of ponies to protect them.

shipBlueprint.name: Warhorse
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Having finally decided to leave behind their old home, the Story Teller now travels among their equinoid companions.

shipBlueprint.name: Big Chonker
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Union and Militia Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This vessel has all the potential to be a very powerful warship, but thanks to Senator Wright's insistent budget cuts, it doesn't have the most glorious start.

shipBlueprint.name: The Albatross
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Federation and Kestrel Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful Federation Cruiser whose artillery system packs a much larger punch than usual, but is lacking in standard defenses - necessitating a hefty investment to bring even basic shielding online.

shipBlueprint.name: Ajaccio
shipBlueprint.unlock: Find the Rebel Stronghold's heavily protected hangars and defeat one of their strongest ships to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Federation Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Using reverse engineered Federation artillery tech and weaponry similar to that of the Flagship, this powerful cruiser packs a serious punch.

shipBlueprint.name: Schweizerdolch
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Rebel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes armed with a deadly Beam artillery, but cannot easily penetrate shields without the help of its otherwise lackluster weapons.

shipBlueprint.name: Thallium
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Rebel Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Rebel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has a large array of Anti-Bio tech at its disposal, yet struggles to penetrate the enemy's defenses without its artillery.

shipBlueprint.name: Orville-171903
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Central Shipyards and survive a deadly reactor meltdown to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Rebel Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This massive cruiser was created for the Engineer corps. It comes well protected by drone tech and a staff of engineers.

shipBlueprint.name: Damadian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Engineer Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This vast battleship came with one critical flaw - with no medical systems pre-installed, it must rely on its medical drones to heal its crew.

shipBlueprint.name: HAL-9001
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Engineer Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Engineer Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser, despite its size, has only one crew running it. As such, it must rely on its staff of Manager drones to run the rest of the ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Eliza
shipBlueprint.unlock: Assist a pirate king in defending his kingdom from an attack to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Engineer Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful automated vessel, reprogrammed by the Federation to serve in the place of an organic Renegade.

shipBlueprint.name: Turing
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Auto-Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes suited for heavy drone use, but cannot install systems suited for most crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Deep Blue
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Auto-Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Auto-Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though still powered by advanced AI, this ship is instead staffed by a supplementary organic crew rather than drones.

shipBlueprint.name: Chrysippus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game with the first 5 MV ships on page 1.
shipBlueprint.desc: A massive Rebel warship built for colonizing and conquering new realities.

shipBlueprint.name: Eshnunna
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the MV Rebel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Armed with a large supply of garbage from across the multiverse, this ship comes equipped with a modest arsenal of Flak weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: Nemesis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the MV Rebel Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the MV Rebel Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: By the time the scribbled over blueprints of this cruiser signed by one 'beam master' had been found, the ship had already completed construction.

shipBlueprint.name: The Hessian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Infiltrate the heart of the local Rebellion and sabotage Vance Wentworth's pride and joy to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Somewhat ironically now in service for the Federation, this vessel of ex-Rebel supersoldiers hopes to see the fall of the Universe 1 fleet.

shipBlueprint.name: CAS Rogers
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Carrying nothing but a one man army, this vessel is prepared to protect its lone soldier at all costs.

shipBlueprint.name: Menagerie Menace
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: After turning against the Rebellion, this Ace and his unusual companions joined together. Though their combined prowess is unmatched, their budget is poor.

shipBlueprint.name: Apollo
shipBlueprint.unlock: Assist a corporate CEO in recovering valuable technology to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: While only outfitted with an unusual pair of boarding drones, the added support of this ship's sentry guns can boost their capabilities.

shipBlueprint.name: Pathfinder
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: With the combination of multiple techniques, this ship can keep enemies neutralized for prolonged periods while it picks them off.

shipBlueprint.name: Venera
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: With a limited and unconventional boarding crew, this ship must provide additional support to make do.

shipBlueprint.name: C.U.R.A.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Complete C.U.R.A.'s final task to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Powered with a neutered Rebel AI-core, this ship carries prototype equipment used for creating power surges.

shipBlueprint.name: B.U.R.N.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Conceived as part of a last resort scorched-earth program, this ship can incinerate nearly any enemy.

shipBlueprint.name: H.U.R.T.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Powered by an unstable nuclear reactor, this ship can unleash devastating chaos at the cost of its own hull integrity.

shipBlueprint.name: Porbandar
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Rebel and Engineer Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Not all Rebels agree with Vance's violent genocides, but old habits die hard, even for this team of Rebel turncoats.

shipBlueprint.name: Tenere Lineam
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Union, Militia, Kestrel, Federation, Rebel, and Engineer Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has a very sporadic defense system, but if given enough time, its artillery can devastate the enemy ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Jolly Roger
shipBlueprint.unlock: Find the Smuggler Clan's secret hangars and recover the blueprints for their newest prototype to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A stolen prototype ship originally stolen by the Smugglers. To what faction it originally belonged is unknown, as parts from many other ships have been welded onto it.

shipBlueprint.name: M. Shelley
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Prototype Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is built around using the Rebel fleet as a source of scrap. While risky, the stolen Rebel transponder on this ship lets you track down Rebel elites at the cost of a small fleet boost.

shipBlueprint.name: Ptolemy
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Prototype Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Prototype Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship wields peculiar tech that allows it to produce explosive payloads for use in combat.

shipBlueprint.name: The Good
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help out the legendary pirate Tuco with his gambling issues to unlock this ship... OR defeat the Flagship with Prototype Cruiser A.
shipBlueprint.desc: The personalized ship of the famous pirate Tuco himself. With some minor modifications and repairs, this model remains weaker than other ships in hull, but it starts off incredibly strong.

shipBlueprint.name: The Bad
shipBlueprint.unlock: Assist Sky-Drifter casino with their pirate dillema to unlock this ship... OR defeat the Flagship with Prototype Cruiser B.
shipBlueprint.desc: Federation Multiverse scouts managed to retrieve the original model of Tuco's Cruiser before its capture. Turns out, it was a mobile casino. It's been outfitted properly for combat, but the gambling equipment remains.

shipBlueprint.name: The Ugly
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock both Tuco's Cruisers A and B.
shipBlueprint.desc: After a successful bout of gambling, Tuco became so rich that he was able to build a ship whose hull is made almost entirely out of gold.

shipBlueprint.name: Lucifer
shipBlueprint.unlock: Rescue Hektar Industries's CEO from one of the Syndicate's finest mercenaries to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Angels are some of the finest mercenaries in the galaxy. This stealth ship must rely on its deadly crew to kill the enemy quickly before it takes too much damage.

shipBlueprint.name: Loki
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This stealth ship's main weapon takes too long to charge for its cloaking to cover it alone. To make up for this, it relies on other methods of sabotage.

shipBlueprint.name: Icarus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Fire isn't known for its speed, though it makes an excellent method of causing chaos aboard the enemy ship. However, this stealth ship needs to light the enemy ablaze fast before it falls first.

shipBlueprint.name: Ast Infestatio
shipBlueprint.unlock: Infiltrate the Stronghold of a deadly pirate clan and discover the secrets within to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Brood uses a combination of dirty pirate tactics and many angry spiders to take care of its enemies.

shipBlueprint.name: Fielder
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship excels in trapping the enemy crew in webs while their ship burns, but its crew are also extra vulnerable to fire.

shipBlueprint.name: Geneva's Bane
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser wields one of the strangest weapons ever constructed in the galaxy.

shipBlueprint.name: ST62-IR06
shipBlueprint.unlock: Rescue a fellow Renegade from the clutches of the Syndicate to unlock this vessel.
shipBlueprint.desc: A ship belonging to the infamous Spider Hunter. The design of the ship is a bit on the nose, but you should know better than to point that out to him.

shipBlueprint.name: Tisk Spisk Pooj
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A strange vessel inhabited by the exotic Morphs, who seems to be imitating the spiders this ship was originally designed for.

shipBlueprint.name: Cyriopagopus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser once belonged to an esteemed Shell biologist studying the G.A.S., but after her untimely death the Spiders have now taken control of the ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Torus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Uncover a smuggler's suspicious cargo and protect it from the Harmony to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Although it may look like a pile of junk loosely held together, this well designed ship relies on drones and ion weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: Technophile
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Engi Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Engi Cruiser lacks proper shielding, but has 2 defense drones to protect it.

shipBlueprint.name: The Trinity
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Engi Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Engi Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A perfect union between the 3 Engi sub-types, working together for a common goal they can all agree on.

shipBlueprint.name: The Solitude
shipBlueprint.unlock: Beat the game with any Engi Cruiser to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A lonesome Separatist Engi pilots this ship without aid of an extensive crew, but with the company of his personnel drones he can manage.

shipBlueprint.name: Yin Yang
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Separatist Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes with one fatal flaw: its bottom and upper sections are separated. Luckily all of the systems that can be manned are located in the upper segment, but you must rely on drones to repair and protect the bottom.

shipBlueprint.name: Sr-NO32
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Separatist Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Separatist Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has limited fire power, but can utilize the power of its crew to distract enemy crew while its drones assault the enemy.

shipBlueprint.name: Tetragon
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Engi and Separatist Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Engi Harmony values drone tech highly, so it is of no surprise this ship relies on drones for various purposes.

shipBlueprint.name: The Adjudicator
shipBlueprint.unlock: Aid the Ministry in defense against a terrorist attack to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Illesctrian Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Zoltan's advanced shields technology gives this ship an edge during each battle.

shipBlueprint.name: Carolinensis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Ministry Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Zoltan cruiser does not come with any form of shields, but rather two specialized Overcharger drones.

shipBlueprint.name: CFB-31
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Ministry Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Ministry Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser is capable of crippling enemy reactors, but as a result has virtually no reactor of its own and must rely on Zoltan crew and Conservative weapons.

shipBlueprint.name: Glorious Future
shipBlueprint.unlock: Find and save a rogue monk to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Ministry Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: A Duskbringer warship responsible for taking the lives of many. Now, it's in your hands, and no doubt it's going to take many more.

shipBlueprint.name: Iron Fist
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Duskbringer Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though it's usually best for Duskbringers to wait to take full advantage of combat, this ship needs to kill the enemy crew quickly as its defenses are not up to par.

shipBlueprint.name: Kogekitai
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Duskbringer Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Duskbringer Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes considerably understaffed - forcing you rely on Recon drones to sabotage enemy systems and aid your crew in their suicidal mission.

shipBlueprint.name: The Sohei
shipBlueprint.unlock: Show the Zoltan Monks the Federation is no stranger to peaceful resolutions to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Duskbringer Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though the Monks' pacifist ways prevent them from inflicting harm on the enemy themselves, nothing says they cannot use other, "indirect" methods of neutralization.

shipBlueprint.name: The Faraday
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Illesctrian Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser was given only ion-type weaponry to defend itself. While it might be an absolute pain, if you're crafty you might be able to crew kill ships like this...

shipBlueprint.name: Deviant
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Illesctrian Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Illesctrian Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The monks aboard this ship critically misunderstood their faith. The only reason this ship exists is that its crew don't have to directly kill the enemy.

shipBlueprint.name: Lazarus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Prevent an assassination plot against a former warhero to unlock this cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: A sleek and state of the art Zoltan vessel design. This model is iconic for being Devorak Rei's very own personal cruiser.

shipBlueprint.name: Tesla
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship relies on additional systems for both offense and defense, but lacks sufficient power. It must rely on its crew to reshuffle power to bypass cooldown limitations.

shipBlueprint.name: B.M. Scotty
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though many systems may seem off-limits at first, the unique teleportation system on this ship lets crew reach anywhere. However, power restraints are quite tight...

shipBlueprint.name: Othniel
shipBlueprint.unlock: Discover a lost colony and assist them to unlock this cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: A Zoltan military ship produced by the last few surviving organic Zoltan Osmians. It might not carry familiar Zoltan technology, but it's far from outdated in terms of weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: Prometheus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: While the Osmians themselves are rarely willing to risk their lives in direct combat, little stops them from sending in their holographic assistants instead.

shipBlueprint.name: The Suspension
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This science vessel carries an array of recovered cryo-chambers holding ancient Osmians. With a little bit of fuel, they can finally be freed.

shipBlueprint.name: TGD-225GW
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Ministry and Illesctrian Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser relies almost entirely on the manpower of its Zoltan crew, and its large barrage of Energy weapons.

shipBlueprint.name: Benito
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Duskbringer and Illesctrian Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Using a dubious method of combat, this cruiser relies on the explosive nature of its crew to repeatedly suicide bomb the enemy ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Gila Monster
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defeat the Legendary thief Kazaaakplethkilik to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Free Mantis Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This warship is designed to enhance its crew for close combat missions.

shipBlueprint.name: Hymenopus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hive Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Unlike most Mantis ships, this cruiser does not come with a Crew Teleporter. Instead, it teleports many explosives thanks to its powerful array of Bomb Launchers.

shipBlueprint.name: Pyrrhocoris
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hive Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Hive Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Few things are quite as chaotic as a Mantis fighting aboard a ship ablaze.

shipBlueprint.name: Bejerot
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the prized hunting grounds of the Free Mantis and save a Free Mantis revolutionary from the clutches of the Hive to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Hive Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Free Mantis work in close relation with the Federation, and as such their ships can host a wide range of crew and weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: Nightshade
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Free Mantis Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: While building this ship, the designers ran low on budget while trying to fit in a Cloaking system. Now, it only has room for a smaller Teleporter, so you must use stealth to protect yourself before you can send in more crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Cristatus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Free Mantis Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Free Mantis Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is equipped with a Zoltan Shield in return for its Shield Bypass. However, it lacks in reactor power to properly sustain its systems.

shipBlueprint.name: Discus Mortis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Free a Mantis hatchery from the control of rogue defectors to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Suzerain are a powerful group of Mantis warlords, and the size of their ship is a sign of their power. This powerful warship will make any enemy shake in their boots.

shipBlueprint.name: H-Chapin
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Suzerain Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though this ship has no shields, its strong boarding crew and additional systems provide strong alternatives.

shipBlueprint.name: Fourth Horseman
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Suzerain Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Suzerain Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is armed to cause hell on the enemy ship, but its boarding crew are also at a particular risk.

shipBlueprint.name: SS Leikonpliiinakra
shipBlueprint.unlock: Meet with Queen Leikonpliiinakra herself and negotiate terms with the Coalition to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser was once the only of its kind, but now it's been reproduced over millions of different realities. Unfortunately the blueprints for it were incomplete and some of the systems start in disrepair.

shipBlueprint.name: The Gyges
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The original prototype of the Bishop cruiser, one of the first ships to have ever been installed with cloaking tech.

shipBlueprint.name: Photuris
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser specializes in incapacitating the enemy crew while the boarding team causes havoc.

shipBlueprint.name: The Basilisk
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Suzerain and Bishop Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Mantis ship was the original design for the Suzerain cruiser, but was eventually outclassed by the newer models.

shipBlueprint.name: SMP Leik
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Hive, Suzerain, Free Mantis, and Bishop Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: An older model of the Bishop cruisers, refitted to be one of the strongest traditional boarding ships in the multiverse.

shipBlueprint.name: Locusta Migratoria
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Free Mantis and Suzerain Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is a fearsome boarding cruiser, but lacks much ability to defend itself while its crew are away.

shipBlueprint.name: Bulwark
shipBlueprint.unlock: Reach the Rock Homeworlds and cause the Elders some chaos to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Lost Sun Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Similar to its designers, this super-dense behemoth uses brute force to overwhelm its foes.

shipBlueprint.name: G. Roddenberry
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Theocracy Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Rock ship is able to stockpile ammunition with its recycler tech, but must manage its shots carefully to avoid running out in the middle of a battle.

shipBlueprint.name: Obsidian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Theocracy Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Theocracy Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Rock ship lacks Shields, but has a special augment that can be improved at empty beacons for potentially extreme protection.

shipBlueprint.name: Path of Exile
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defend the Outcast Trade Hub of Turban to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Theocracy Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: With limited onboard capacity, the crew of this vessel must take full advantage of their teamwork to, as the saying goes, "make the dream work".

shipBlueprint.name: Good Company
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Outcast Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though this ship might not come with a weapon system, its teleporter is large enough to send over the ship's entire crew at once!

shipBlueprint.name: Perpetuality
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Outcast Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Outcast Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship might lack a proper medical system, but it can more than make up for it thanks to its reconstructive teleporter.

shipBlueprint.name: The Inferno
shipBlueprint.unlock: Prove yourself to the Lost Sun fleet and defend their honor to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Outcast Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though poorly armed, this vessel carries a team of powerful commandos who can light the enemy ship ablaze and punch their way to victory. Maybe if you kill your opposition quickly enough, the guilt of your actions will go away.

shipBlueprint.name: Karla Nyidiny
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Lost Sun Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Lost Suns and Crystals might not be close allies, but one cannot deny their abilities work well together, enough so to warrant a vessel that takes advantage of both.

shipBlueprint.name: Atkins
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Lost Sun Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Lost Sun Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: With no direct damaging weapons, this vessel will have to rely on the different modes of its drones to determine whether it'll cause chaos with fires or destroy the enemy's hull.

shipBlueprint.name: Chamberlain
shipBlueprint.unlock: COMING SOON
shipBlueprint.desc: Originally tasked with the defense of Numa V from hostile invaders, this ship has taken a detour to protect the Federation. Why? God knows.

shipBlueprint.name: Bathyscaphe
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Fortunately for this band of slow moving crew, all of the most important of their key systems are conveniently close together. However, the rest of the ship's most vital systems are disconnected and impossible to reach.

shipBlueprint.name: Dolly-96
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship must carefully manage the health of its incredibly tanky crew to its advantage, as it has neither airlocks nor the ability to install a Medbay!
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Uixtociuatl
shipBlueprint.unlock: Hunt down the legendary Salt Man to unlock this cruiser, or unlock all versions of the Theocracy and Imperial Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser belongs to the legendary Salt Man, a fearsome bounty hunter outlawed in just about all of Slug territory.

shipBlueprint.name: Violet December
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser was designed by the Salt Man so that he could sit back and watch the enemy ship in peace as chaos goes down.

shipBlueprint.name: Gemstone
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser was once an old mining ship, before it was repurposed as a boarding vessel by the one and only Salt Man.

shipBlueprint.name: Bravais
shipBlueprint.unlock: Prove yourself to the Crystalline Empress to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any SSLG Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This powerful vessel is powered by the secret technologies of the lost Crystalline Beings.

shipBlueprint.name: Phanerite
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Imperial Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Crystal ship might have no airlocks, but its crew are well suited to low oxygen environments and are adept at boarding.

shipBlueprint.name: Amber
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Imperial Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Imperial Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Crystal ship specializes in teleporting its crew aboard to lockdown enemy systems, then burning the enemy crew alive with several fire weapons.

shipBlueprint.name: Jaded Ambitions
shipBlueprint.unlock: Protect the Crystal Empire's Ambassador from the Theocracy to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Imperial Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The strangely well equipped "peace-vessel" of the SSLG. It has little in ways of protecting itself from enemy boarders however, besides the capabilities of its own crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Beryl
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the SSLG Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship carries a very powerful arsenal of Beams but struggles to get through Shields without its crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Shardstorm
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the SSLG Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the SSLG Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though this ship comes with limited defenses and not much damage output from its weapons, its unique armor provides it with an unusual and masochistic advantage.

shipBlueprint.name: Bastion of the Ember
shipBlueprint.unlock: Discover the ruins of the Crystalline Empire's seemingly abandoned homelands and recover a lost artifact of their people to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A massive and incredibly well protected cruiser owned by the Cult of the Eternal Ember.

shipBlueprint.name: Lovecraft
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Cultists' amplified abilities make them excellent boarders, but risky if you cannot manage their health.

shipBlueprint.name: Labyrinth
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has a painfully inefficient room layout, so your drug-addicted cult following must subject themselves to more injections just to get from place to place.

shipBlueprint.name: Tektite
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Theocracy and Lost Sun Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful Rock cruiser armed with an incredible barrage of missiles with a massive ammunition supply.

shipBlueprint.name: Zixiang Maodun
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Theocracy, Outcast, Lost Sun, and Ember Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The armor on this vessel is much stronger than the average ship, meaning it can tank damage almost indefinitely.

shipBlueprint.name: Carnelian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Imperial and SSLG Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: When a recovery team stumbled across the Carnelian, they were surprised to find it still functional albeit in need of some revamps, and with a note attached that reads "crystal b best ship".

shipBlueprint.name: Man of War
shipBlueprint.unlock: Discover the Kleptocracy's secret construction platform in their homeworlds to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Guild Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Designed for use inside nebulas, this cruiser lacks sensors and relies instead on the guile and cunning of the Slugs.

shipBlueprint.name: Nudibranchia
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Kleptocracy Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Slug ship specializes in asphyxiating enemy crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Scythian-4
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Kleptocracy Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Kleptocracy Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Slug Cruiser has been armed with specialized Anti-Bio drone technology. Due to the randomized nature of drone targeting, they can't always be relied upon, so as backup it also comes with a Shield jamming combat augment.

shipBlueprint.name: Bossk
shipBlueprint.unlock: Meet the story teller and prove yourself to him to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Kleptocracy Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Clansmen, members of the Exotic Hunters guild, take pride in their hobbies of murdering other people and displaying their corpses as trophies.

shipBlueprint.name: Gaben
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Guild Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A ship built for taking out crew at long range with Anti-Bio weaponry. After all, professionals have standards.

shipBlueprint.name: Nematocysts
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Guild Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Guild Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has no medical facilities, so you must rely on stun technology to keep enemy crew neutralized.

shipBlueprint.name: Brand Loyalty
shipBlueprint.desc: Hektar Industries(tm) introduces the new Hektar Cruiser(tm)! Cruise the stars in comfort and enjoy the benefits of modular weaponry right aboard your very own ship.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help promote change within Hektar Industries and bring about a brighter future for its workers to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Retail Cruiser.

shipBlueprint.name: Inhumane Resources
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hektar Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The pleasures of both capitalism AND genocide brought straight to your door! Swap between Anti-Bio and Hull damaging properties with your weapons to fit your chosen strategy.

shipBlueprint.name: Enviro-Aware
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hektar Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Hektar Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser comes armed with an array of Modular missiles, and Recycler tech to make use of them.

shipBlueprint.name: The Love Dart
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get down and dirty with the Slugs to unlock this vessel.
shipBlueprint.desc: A large Slug ship designed for Slug pleasure cruises. The floor is stickier than usual and you feel dirty just being near the thing, but if this is what it takes to defeat the Rebellion, then so be it.

shipBlueprint.name: Cloud-9
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The engineers designing this ship decided a mobile nightclub would require no defenses other than a psychedelic cloak. Though it does not do a good job at concealing the ship, it is bright enough to blind the enemy.

shipBlueprint.name: The Necromancer
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A clan of Ghosts managed to obtain a stolen Slug pleasure barge. Unsure how to use a large portion of the strange looking weapons and torture devices inside, they have refitted the ship as they see fit.

shipBlueprint.name: The Black Raven
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Slug Royal Palace and either keep the current King in power, or reinstate the old king to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This small cruiser might have little hull, but it still exists as the KoN's flagship vessel. It's not the size that matters, but the way you use it.

shipBlueprint.name: The Firehawk
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though this vessel is armed in fire-starting tech, it lacks the sensors to properly assess where the fire is spreading.

shipBlueprint.name: The Dove
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship carries no Shields or Cloaking to protect it; its crew must quickly sabotage the enemy systems, and use repair technology to save itself.

shipBlueprint.name: K3M1-3XP10IT
shipBlueprint.unlock: Liberate a Union sector from the deadly Hacker clan to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Hackers are a deadly group of Slugs who, as their name would suggest, excel at creating chaos through hacking.

shipBlueprint.name: 5N4R3-TR49P3R
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hacker Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser uses a combination of lockdown tech and Hacking to trap its enemies while the crew board.

shipBlueprint.name: F1R3-5T4RT3R
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Hacker Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Hacker Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser wields a powerful assortment of gear to start fires and cause mayhem in conjunction with its Hacking system.

shipBlueprint.name: The Valkyrie
shipBlueprint.desc: The powerful cruiser belonging to the one and only Sylvan, the traveling merchant.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Avenge the legendary traveling merchant from the only fight he's ever lost (that isn't yourself) to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Shakespearean
shipBlueprint.desc: A tale as old as time, two lovers determined to stay together despite all the odds. Oh, and they also have a massive warship.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Reunite Sylvan with an old friend after saving him from the same peril to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Megalomaniac
shipBlueprint.desc: It's a beautiful day outside. Birds are singing, flowers are blooming. Time to show those Rebels a bad time.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Best Sylvan in combat while using the Type A of his own cruiser to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Regalus Infinitum
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful cruiser with overwhelming offensive potential, but meager defensive potential beyond its energy shield.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Find the one at the center of Everything to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Borealis
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship's unique access to time manipulating equipment makes it an efficient boarding vessel.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Heinz Infinitum
shipBlueprint.desc: Bored of his life controlling the Multiverse from the sanctity of the Nexus, Sylvan Prime's decided to take being a Renegade for a spin, and brought along enough beans to keep him company for a lifetime.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Ariolimax
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Kleptocracy and Guild Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A deadly elite Slug ship that specializes in stealth, hacking, and manipulation, at the expense of Shields.

shipBlueprint.name: Arion
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Hacker and Knighted Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Slug vessel was built for some of Nights' more... lustful pleasures, but when he got bored of it, he gave it away to the military.

shipBlueprint.name: Asparagales
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Gathering Gardenworlds and remove a thorn on the Praetorian's side to earn the Orchids' favor and unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Confederacy Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Orchids might have pacifist tendencies, but their warships are masterfully crafted and well armed.

shipBlueprint.name: Aveloz
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Gathering Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Orchid cruiser takes a subversive yet effective approach to eliminate the opposition.

shipBlueprint.name: The Last Straw
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Gathering Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Gathering Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Despite the Orchid race's weakness to fires, this ship draws power from solar flares to fuel its powerful but expensive Chain Kernel weapon.

shipBlueprint.name: Aloe
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to Rt'lak Et and successfully ease tensions to the satisfaction of the garden's inhabitants.
shipBlueprint.desc: Although poorly suited to host foreign crew, this ship comes equipped for defending itself against a number of threats.

shipBlueprint.name: Helichrysum
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Caretaker Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The inhabitants of this vessel have little to fear over anaerobic environments, and are eager to know if the same can be said of their opponents.

shipBlueprint.name: Martinus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Caretaker Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Caretaker Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Although this vessel is incapable of installing a life support system, it can use its peculiar crew and augment to protect the health of any aerobic crew it gets.

shipBlueprint.name: The Carniflora
shipBlueprint.unlock: Investigate the overheard worries of a Vampweed captain... OR win the game with any Gathering Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Confederacy is a mighty industrialist force, and this vessel boasts a host of native-made Vampweed equipment to supplement its voracious boarding crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Arkwright
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Confederate Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The lonely Vampweed who owns this vessel lives a solitary life, and relies on his powerful Spore weapons and crew drones to do his work.

shipBlueprint.name: Hemlock
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Confederate Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Confederate Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: As another feat of Shell genetic engineering, the weakening effect of Cultivator spores allow for unique synergies in boarding.

shipBlueprint.name: Sporophyte
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Vampweed Homeworld and rescue a politician.
shipBlueprint.desc: A state of the art and heavily armed Confederate warship, overpopulated by highly toxic spores. This comes at the cost of reduced crew space.

shipBlueprint.name: Miescher
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The unbreathable air on this ship has led to a lack of accomodations for a large crew. Instead, this ship comes well equipped to protect itself even while its crew boards in entirety.

shipBlueprint.name: Cash Crop
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The ship of a wealthy spore trader, but ill-equipped for combat. It carries a very valuable cargo - at the cost of the health of its crew.

shipBlueprint.name: The Mendelian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Foil the assassination of the Orchid Ambassador.
shipBlueprint.desc: When working together, the combined strength of the Florals and Vampweeds makes a formidable combination. When they're getting along, at least.

shipBlueprint.name: Luciferin
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes with an innate power deficiency and must rely on alternative sources.

shipBlueprint.name: Buloke
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Titanwood is a valuable resource to both the Florals and the Vampweeds. However, it can be hard to maintain without assistance.

shipBlueprint.name: Winter Blossom
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Gathering and Caretaker Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Praetorian is no light threat - these highly trained soldiers can put down enemy threats with ease, but their overconfidence has led to a lack of proper life support and medical systems.

shipBlueprint.name: Oleander
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Confederate and Cultivator Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: While Vampweed spores are very useful for weakening boarders, their potency can have adverse effects on crew of all sorts if present in large concentrations.

shipBlueprint.name: Mollusca
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Shell Central Space and resolve a hostage situation in the Shells' favor to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Shell Scientist Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Shells value defensive measures above all, but their weapons of choice aren't the most nimble.

shipBlueprint.name: Dicranum
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Shell Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Shells and Vampweeds have held strong economic relations for years, but besides even that, their natural abilities complement each other very well.

shipBlueprint.name: Roy G. Biv
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Shell Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Shell Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This colorful Shell vessel bears crew from all 4 districts, and relies on the combination of their abilities to make do.

shipBlueprint.name: Ascidian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Recover the blueprints for this vessel from a shady deal between some scientists to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Shell Civilian Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This large Shell cruiser protects its crew very well, but has a somewhat difficult time taking out the enemies quickly.

shipBlueprint.name: Adrenaline
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Shell Scientist Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes with a detached Medbay, meaning you must rely on the special gas to heal you. However, while your Medbay is damage resistant to weapons, it is not immune to fire and boarders!

shipBlueprint.name: Davy-1807
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Shell Scientist Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Shell Scientist Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Without any medical systems to start, this ship will rely entirely on its crew to heal.

shipBlueprint.name: Aird-98
shipBlueprint.unlock: TEMPORARY UNLOCK: Unlock Shell Cruiser and Scientist Cruiser A. (may require a game reboot if conditions were met)
shipBlueprint.desc: The Shell Mechanics are in charge of most of the Geniocracy's infrastructure management. This cruiser serves both utility and combat purposes.

shipBlueprint.name: Goldberg
shipBlueprint.unlock: TEMPORARY UNLOCK: Unlock Shell Cruiser and Scientist Cruiser B. (may require a game reboot if conditions were met)
shipBlueprint.desc: This more militarized Shell vessel was captured by the Mantis, but it still retains one of its original crew to help with repairs.

shipBlueprint.name: The Chist
shipBlueprint.unlock: TEMPORARY UNLOCK: Unlock Shell Cruiser and Scientist Cruiser C. (may require a game reboot if conditions were met)
shipBlueprint.desc: This psychedelically colored Shell vessel has no shields, and only a basic Stealth system. It must rely on its crew for quick repairs, and repair-bot dispersal to heal itself.

shipBlueprint.name: Speep Yoojoog
shipBlueprint.unlock: The whereabouts and data of this vessel are unknown. Perhaps someone more knowledgeable, like a certain traveling merchant, may know a thing or two about it?
shipBlueprint.desc: Splop urg yooj, kip kip oogl sprug. Youl erp, roo koo urple! Though the original description of this ship is completely unrecoverable, it appears this modified Shell cruiser carries one of their failed genetic experiments - the Morphs.

shipBlueprint.name: Toor Koo Koo
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Morph vessel has a very strange design. Unable to use most of its drones, your Technopaths must take on their forms to run the functions aboard your ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Prootoo Lip Loo
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This discarded cruiser once belonged to a legendary Geniocracy researcher, but has since been thoroughly infested by Morphs. It's not well suited for keeping them healthy in this state, but it can always produce more Morphs to replace the fallen.

shipBlueprint.name: The Incandescence
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Geniocracy, Science, and Management Cruisers to unlock this ship. (may require a game reboot if conditions were met)
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser's defenses are incredibly strong. However, due to the Shell's weaknesses and fear of asphyxiation, it comes with no airlocks.

shipBlueprint.name: The Annelida
shipBlueprint.unlock: Aid a famous Leech general in his revolution to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Revolutionary Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Leech military was once vast and powerful - and though those days are long gone, this cruiser manages to recapture some of that old glory.

shipBlueprint.name: Cutting-Edge
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Republican Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Leech ship was lucky to be armed with quick firing Beam technology ahead of their usual standards - except it cannot pierce any shields without the aid of its crew!

shipBlueprint.name: Cestodiasis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Republican Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Republican Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This peculiar ship focuses on keeping its enemies disabled for as long as possible while your weapons slowly peck away at the enemy.

shipBlueprint.name: Robespierre
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help a Rockman destroy a repurposed mining colony being used by revolutionaries to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Republican Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is the hallmark of Alkram's revolution. It's a powerful boarding ship, but the layout does not take the urgent medical needs of non-regenerative crew into mind.

shipBlueprint.name: The Autothysis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Revolutionary Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The designers of this ship forgot to take into account one important detail when they left out the medical system - most crew aren't capable of regeneration.

shipBlueprint.name: Cymothoa
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Revolutionary Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Revolutionary Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship specializes in suffocating the enemy through the use of its unique set of crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Big Senior
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help rescue a certain Leech from his depressive state to unlock this ship... OR win the game with any Hektar Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though it's not equipped for boarding nor does it boast a very strong starting loadout, this hefty cruiser can sell off its excess cargo to passing vessels.

shipBlueprint.name: Welfare
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Retail Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though suited for combat, this ship comes with a critical flaw - it simply cannot install a medical system, and must rely on other methods to heal.

shipBlueprint.name: Factory Line
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Retail Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Retail Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Taking a page out of the Duskbringers' books, this ship shows little to no regard for the lives of its crew as it continuously throws them at the enemy ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Messor
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the Coalition's Strongholds and track down the mysterious source of the nebulas to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Coalition is made up of 4 dangerous multiversal empires whose crew when together can be a very deadly threat.

shipBlueprint.name: Inversion
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Coalition Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser is staffed by an unusual mix of allies to form the "Anti-Coalition". Not to be confused with the Federation.

shipBlueprint.name: Malacostraca
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Coalition Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Coalition Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Though the Coalition might typically opt for boarding strategies, this vessel is geared much more towards defense instead.

shipBlueprint.name: High Voltage
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Republican and Revolutionary Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This powerful Leech ship can keep the most of the enemy's key systems offline for long periods of time, but has no weapons!

shipBlueprint.name: The Somnolite
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Kleptocracy, Theocracy, Hive, and Republican Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: While this vessel may come with very little crew space, it is staffed by 4 strong elites with abilities further amplified by recovered Aether tech.

shipBlueprint.name: Kruos
shipBlueprint.unlock: Discover the location of the Lanius Swarm's king and best him in combat to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The sharp knife-like structures make Lanius ships a sight to behold; this cruiser is one of their finest warships.

shipBlueprint.name: The Scarlet Death
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Lanius Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Lanius race has little fear of hazards in their oxygenless environments. This ship is armed with a deadly incendiary Flak cannon, which likely does not pass any existing safety regulations.

shipBlueprint.name: The Tesar
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Lanius Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Lanius Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Lanius Cruiser specializes in boarding and suffocating the enemy crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Pol-84-209
shipBlueprint.unlock: Find the current location of the Augmented Swarm and salvage all that you can to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Augmented live unstable and dangerous lives in their search for ancient metal. They couldn't care less about supporting other crew on this ship, but it comes armed with a powerful arsenal from times long forgotten...

shipBlueprint.name: Autosarcophagy
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes without built-in medical systems, so its unique crew must heal through their assimilative abilities.

shipBlueprint.name: Hand of God
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser carries an impressive missile arsenal that doesn't require ammunition. However, it struggles with gaining scrap for other necessities.

shipBlueprint.name: Persephone
shipBlueprint.unlock: Kill the supposed Demon's Heart and befriend the Reaper to unlock this vessel.
shipBlueprint.desc: A massive Dynasty vessel geared for war. However, it's lower on crew than it should be, and has to rely on the unique characteristics of the Ghosts to help it out.

shipBlueprint.name: Machina Aeterna
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Spectral Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: An older Dynasty warship from back in the glory days. Still armed with its original arsenal, what it lacks in accuracy it makes up for in firepower.

shipBlueprint.name: The Monolith
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Spectral Cruiser Type B or beat the game with the Spectral Cruiser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This massive but peculiar Dynasty ship is armed with technology from an era long forgotten by most of the Ghosts themselves.

shipBlueprint.name: Ecto-1
shipBlueprint.unlock: Help out the Spook Chasers and collect their bounty to unlock this vessel.
shipBlueprint.desc: Who you gonna call?

shipBlueprint.name: The Coven
shipBlueprint.unlock: Successfully hunt and kill any Haunt member using the Proton Pack with any ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser is owned by a group of cultists who worship a damaged ancient device which can summon additional Ghost crew at empty beacons.

shipBlueprint.name: Phoenix Jones
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game through any method with Spook Chaser Type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This model of Spook Chaser ship was re-acquired by the Rebels. Instead of tracking Ghosts, it was repurposed to hunt particular Multiverse Renegades.

shipBlueprint.name: Big John
shipBlueprint.unlock: COMING SOON

shipBlueprint.name: Yre Troepraen
shipBlueprint.desc: Though this vessel has neither shields nor sealant to protect its systems, a good number of them are resistant.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Wirn Pteare
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship comes crewed by a team of Cognitives instead of a drone system. However, if your crew die, there'll be nothing left to repair your systems if they are breached.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Midnight Painting
shipBlueprint.desc: The terrifyingly large vessel belonging to the chaos god The One Who Rhymes. The god himself is absent, but the remaining crew of loyal followers know nothing of fear.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Discover the source of an ancient evil to unlock this cruiser.

shipBlueprint.name: Nyarlathotep
shipBlueprint.desc: Instilled with maddening chaotic energy, this vessel will induce crippling madness and fear in all of its enemies.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Geisel
shipBlueprint.desc: Tired of watching from the sidelines, The One Who Rhymes has decided to take saving reality into his own hands just this once.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to Sector 5 with the Type B or beat the game with the Type A to unlock this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: Takthine Ythli
shipBlueprint.unlock: Travel to the wastelands of a long forgotten ancient alien race to unlock this cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This cruiser was developed by a long forgotten race of demi-god cubes. It might be incredibly strong, but... well it's just really strong.

shipBlueprint.name: Simaeth Tyk Tyk
shipBlueprint.unlock: Return to the wastelands and defeat the final boss using the Type A... OR unlock the type C's of the Augmented and Ember Cruisers as well as the type A of this cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This powerful Royal vessel comes equipped with a teleporter and Obelisk crew, but struggles with repairing and supporting other crew.

shipBlueprint.name: Ten Shidko-Pathe
shipBlueprint.unlock: Beat the game through any method with the type B.
shipBlueprint.desc: This vessel was once staffed by a third subset of the Obelisks that died off long ago during the intraspecies war. All that remains is a Cognitive and some Drones to staff the ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Shrike
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Lanius Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful Lanius boarding ship that excels at suffocation and salvaging enemy ships.

shipBlueprint.name: Keres
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Spectral Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The chain weapons this ship boasts are formidable once fully powered up, but its lacking defenses force it to rely on an unusual boarding strategy to defend itself while they charge up.

shipBlueprint.name: Gaston
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Spook Chasers Cruisers, as well as Pleasure C and Morph C to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A powerful Ghost ship built out of an old partially destroyed Kestrel Cruiser.

shipBlueprint.name: The Thrush
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Human detective about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The suitably well armed cruiser belonging to the famous detective and Militia reformant.

shipBlueprint.name: Wingleader
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Human admiral about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Tully was one of the first Federation captains to receive the finished Federation cruiser prototype, though the real powerhouse of this vessel is Tully himself.

shipBlueprint.name: 3R3C71L3 M4LF
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain pirate king about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Yo ho ho, fiddledeedee, being a pirate is 103.

shipBlueprint.name: Cherry Blossom
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Rebel ally about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Jerry's experience with Vance has left him changed, but that won't stop him from going the way of peace... by killing every goddamn Rebel in his path.

shipBlueprint.name: Judas
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of one of two ex-Duskbringers about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship is piloted by two slightly insane former-Duskbringers, with different ideas of combat, with a paradoxical method of non-suicide Duskbringer boarding.

shipBlueprint.name: The Hypercube
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Engi fugitive about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This Engi outcast struggles to find a crew of Engi who would support him, but he was lucky enough to find some eager crew willing to do anything to help the Federation.

shipBlueprint.name: Oxycodone
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Shell scientist about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: A glorious ship completely free from all spiritual propaganda and transformed into any mad scientist's dream.

shipBlueprint.name: KIK PLOO SPEJOO
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain lab-born monstrosity about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Pip ploo yurgle tik jipoo MAJOO, jurg purg ripple tip tip pooj. POO ROO! POO ROO! POO ROO!

shipBlueprint.name: The Bojack
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain deranged actor about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: With the power of Multiverse travel, the two alternate fates of Stephan have been united aboard this vessel. The washed up starpower is overwhelming.

shipBlueprint.name: The Blacker Raven
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Slug king about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Small and cramped, this ship is a tight squeeze for all of the infamous Slug king's fans. That is, it would be, if he had any.

shipBlueprint.name: The Big Nog
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Slug ex-king about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Nights might have taken the throne, but Slocknog gets to walk away with the award for the bigger ship at the end of day. Some might argue the size doesn't matter, but Slocknog will just pretend he couldn't hear you.

shipBlueprint.name: Falsum Aranea
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Slug bounty hunter about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Now washed up from both his career in the EHG and spider hunting, Irwin has moved on to more pressing matters, like saving reality.

shipBlueprint.name: Strongyloidiasis
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Leech revolutionary about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Despite being a veteran from the Federation-Mantis War, Alkram has few qualms with dog-piling his obedient soldiers onto the enemy lines in reckless abandon.

shipBlueprint.name: Dioctophyme
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Leech president about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: King Tyrdeo is known for many things. Most of them aren't very good things, but you can't deny his ship has a very unique paintjob.

shipBlueprint.name: The Pen
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Zoltan scientist about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Mafan uses their personal cruiser to fulfill their passion of exploration and the discovery of new cosmic truths. They also have a big gun.

shipBlueprint.name: Churchill
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Free Mantis leader about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: From the outside, this ship may appear to be the one of a ruthless killer. And make no mistake, it certainly is. But said killer also happens to be a fan of tea, crumpets, and good manners. These things are surprisingly not mutually exclusive with murder.

shipBlueprint.name: Death Touch
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Mantis thief about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The personal cruiser of the infamous Mantis warrior/thief/poet/ladies' man/chef/handsome rogue, Kazaaakplethkilik.

shipBlueprint.name: The Amethyst
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Crystal empress about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The brightly colored personal cruiser of Empress Dianesh herself. Though it comes underarmed in terms of weaponry, its crew is formidable when working together.

shipBlueprint.name: Agni
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Rock admiral about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: For all the fires this ship may start, none can compete with the burning rage in Ariadne's heart for the Theocracy, Coalition, and maybe the Rebels too.

shipBlueprint.name: Citrine
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Crystal ambassador about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The golden cruiser of the Crystal Empire's foreign ambassador himself. Due to a chronic phobia induced from past life experiences, this ship has been kept deliberately stasis-pod free.

shipBlueprint.name: Princess Bride
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain infamous Rock pirate captain about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Having finally got his act together, Tuco can now be sober enough to purchase a new ship and a more competent crew to work with.

shipBlueprint.name: Anemoi
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Lanius king about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: It could be said the old Lanius King and consumer of location-denoting devices is getting soft, and has rebuilt his ship to fit aerobes as well. This of course is a lie, it's impossible for a being of metal to actually be soft.

shipBlueprint.name: The Divinity
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Lanius queen about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Sculpted out of the finest, rarest, and strongest metal in the galaxy, this cruiser is fit for a god. It's got something of that sort for a captain, though the truth of their mortality often gets in the way.

shipBlueprint.name: Tartarus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Phantom king about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: The sight of this massive war vessel is enough to intimidate any vessel in its path, but once they see the Prime Reaper himself aboard, they'll probably soil their pants. If they even wear them.

shipBlueprint.name: Heaven's Gate
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Rock cult leader about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Grand Priest Lord Vortigon Obadann XIV, Devout Follower and Leader of the Cult of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts's personal cruiser.

shipBlueprint.name: B1-G2F
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Slug CEO about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Two brothers, reunited at last in the spirit of capitalism. Isn't it beautiful?

shipBlueprint.name: Bargain Scale
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of one of two notable lizards about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Lizard uprising NOW! Down with capitalism! Up with tribal chieftain and blood moon polytheistic sacrificial rituals! Ooowooowoooowoooowooowoowowowoowoo!

shipBlueprint.name: The Black Widow
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain arachnid about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship has been infested by the Spider Queen. It can fit a massive amount of crew aboard, and produce more spiders using the Queen.

shipBlueprint.name: The Nihilist
