shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain mysterious bounty hunter about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: On his eternal quest to find the last few survivors of his species, Obyn inevitably encountered more of himself searching across the realities. They can't exactly reproduce, but they can party the days away aboard this vessel.

shipBlueprint.name: Unholy Mistake
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of one of a two certain former "butt-buddies" about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Having thought they were finally safe from each other, these three former business partners have now been forced back together to help save reality.

shipBlueprint.name: Makt-Lithe Gaethpro
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all other unique crew ships to unlock the ultimate Multiverse cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The gang's all here! This cruiser carries every single unique crew in the mod, and can fit quite a few too. Don't expect it to be balanced; that's not what it's here for.

shipBlueprint.name: Weedwacker
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of ??? about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: No one's sure who authorized this vessel, or why. It just showed up one day, with a small sticky-note stuck to the side which reads "cry about it".

shipBlueprint.name: Rafflesia
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Floral gardener about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: After a lifetime of the Gathering only valuing her talents, Mayeb decided to find some friends who would appreciate her more. The Shells that she found along the way still only appreciate her gardening, but at least they're honest about it.

shipBlueprint.name: Haywire Fever
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Confederate premier about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: This early Cultivator cruiser design was later renovated by Ivar himself. Nobody is quite sure as to why he wanted it to be purple. Must be his favorite color or something.

shipBlueprint.name: Rosemary
shipBlueprint.unlock: Consult the advice of a certain Orchid ambassador about a certain artifact to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Ty E'Rel's personal cruiser, given to him by the Confederacy. Intended for recreational use rather than official duties, it normally sees practically zero use.

shipBlueprint.name: The Kestrel
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Kestrel Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: This class of ship was decommissioned from Federation service years ago. After a number of refits and updates this classic ship is ready for battle.

shipBlueprint.name: Red-Tail
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Kestrel Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This modified Kestrel class ship was created by a laser weapon aficionado.

shipBlueprint.name: The Swallow
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Kestrel B.
shipBlueprint.desc: This model was modified by pirates to utilize newly discovered technology.  It can clone lost crewmembers and stun enemies.

shipBlueprint.name: The Torus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Engi Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: Although it may look like a pile of junk loosely held together, this well designed ship relies on drones and ion weaponry.

shipBlueprint.name: The Vortex
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Engi Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Heavily understaffed, this ship relies on drones to keep the ship running.

shipBlueprint.name: Tetragon
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Engi B.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Engi were quick to adapt to the sudden surge of hacking technology - this ship is the result of their research.

shipBlueprint.name: The Osprey
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Federation Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship features the latest in Federation technology: an advanced beam weapon that pierces through shields.

shipBlueprint.name: Nisos
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Federation Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship starts with additional Artillery power, encouraging heavy reliance on the beam.

shipBlueprint.name: The Fregatidae
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Federation B.
shipBlueprint.desc: With a Flak Artillery weapon and an improved Clonebay, only the most suicidal of infantry chooses to fly on this ship.

shipBlueprint.name: The Adjudicator
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Ministry Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: The Zoltan's advanced shields technology gives this ship an edge during each battle.

shipBlueprint.name: Noether
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Ministry Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship starts with a weakened Shield system and must rely on its supershield.

shipBlueprint.name: Cerenkov
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Zoltan B.
shipBlueprint.desc: The designer of this ship was not willing to spend the money for a decent reactor. Instead it relies on its Zoltan crew and Backup Battery.

shipBlueprint.name: The Gila Monster
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Hive Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: This warship is designed to enhance its crew for close combat missions.

shipBlueprint.name: The Basilisk
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Hive Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This warship encourages sending massive boarding parties and keeping strong defenses.

shipBlueprint.name: The Theseus
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Mantis B.
shipBlueprint.desc: With a large teleporter and weapons designed to impede enemy crew, this ship is deadly in the hands of a capable boarding party.

shipBlueprint.name: Man of War
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Kleptocracy Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: Designed for use inside nebulas, this cruiser lacks sensors and relies instead on the guile and cunning of the Slugs.

shipBlueprint.name: The Stormwalker
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Kleptocracy Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: This boarding ship has no medical facilities and must manage its explosives carefully to keep the crew alive.

shipBlueprint.name: Ariolimax
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Slug B.
shipBlueprint.desc: Slugs are often skilled in the arts of misdirection and manipulation. With Hacking and Mind Control systems, this ship capitalizes on that fact.

shipBlueprint.name: Bulwark
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Theocracy Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: Similar to its designers, this super-dense behemoth uses brute force to overwhelm its foes.

shipBlueprint.name: Shivan
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Theocracy Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: With no airlocks, this ship must rely entirely on its rock crew to put out fires.

shipBlueprint.name: Tektite
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Rock B.
shipBlueprint.desc: Contact has been made with the Crystalline race and this cruiser was offered to the Federation as part of diplomatic discussions between the sister species.

shipBlueprint.name: The Nesasio
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Stealth Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: Constructed for the Federation by the Engi, this ship is designed to use cloaking technology and speed to get behind enemy lines.

shipBlueprint.name: DA-SR 12
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Stealth Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Built like a glass cannon, this ship is hard to handle. If its cloaking can keep it safe long enough to charge its weapon, few cruisers can withstand its might.

shipBlueprint.name: Simo-H
shipBlueprint.unlock: Get to sector 8 with the Vanilla Stealth B.
shipBlueprint.desc: This ship was part of an Engi experiment to make a power efficient version of the Zoltan shield. Unfortunately this required the removal of the Cloaking system.

shipBlueprint.name: Kruos
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Lanius Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: The sharp knife-like structures make Lanius ships a sight to behold. This cruiser was adapted to support the other races of the Federation.

shipBlueprint.name: The Shrike
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Lanius Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: The racial ability of the Lanius make them fearsome combatants in small quarters. Combine that with a Mind Control system and this ship is a force to be reckoned with.

shipBlueprint.name: Bravais
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A, B, and C of the Imperial Cruisers.
shipBlueprint.desc: This powerful vessel is powered by the secret technologies of the lost Crystalline Beings.

shipBlueprint.name: Carnelian
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win with the type C of the Imperial Cruiser.
shipBlueprint.desc: Their unique racial ability makes the Crystal beings very adept at ship boarding. This ship was designed for such raiding parties.

shipBlueprint.name: The Limit
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game using any Elite vessel to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Feeling up for a challenge? This cruiser is very poorly optimized, and thus can only upgrade its systems to lower than normal thresholds.

shipBlueprint.name: The Limit II
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game using the Limit to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Contrary to typical logic, this ship is not better than its Mk I version. In fact, it's quite worse.

shipBlueprint.name: The Limit III
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game using the Limit 2 to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: By playing this ship, you sign away your right to have fun.

shipBlueprint.name: The Final Limit
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defeat Sylvan using the Limit 3 or beat the True Ending with all other Limits to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: It is rumored that somewhere, in some dark crevice, some unholy forsaken land within the Multiverse, a ship was conceived. The final limit.

shipBlueprint.name: The Crapbucket
shipBlueprint.unlock: Make a very suspicious purchase to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: You bought this literal piece of junk for 500 scrap from a Ghost shop you didn't even think was real. Good job?

shipBlueprint.name: P.O.S.
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game using the type A to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: From the delinquent Ghosts who brought you the Crapbucket, we introduce you now to the one and only Piece of Shit.

shipBlueprint.name: The Dumpster Fire
shipBlueprint.unlock: Complete the true ending with the type A and B to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: In some far away universe where logic clearly didn't exist, someone decided to take the Crapbucket one step further, and invite an all-star cast with it.

shipBlueprint.name: Stranger Danger
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock the type A of every ship on pages 1 to 13, all crewsers and all vanilla cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Impressed by your collection of ships, the Sylvans of the Nexus have decided to award you a very special vessel to complete your fleet.

shipBlueprint.name: The Cheatcode
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all other ships in the game (minus the ship slot under this one) to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: No one's quite sure where the forge on this ship came from, but those who use it seem to be instilled with the natural inclination to create bigger and bigger guns.

shipBlueprint.name: Handford
shipBlueprint.unlock: Win the game with all variants of non-Elite ships on pages 1 to 13 to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Created in a dark pact with the space-time criminal Wallace, this ship can effectively become anything its captain desires. A blank slate, one might say.

shipBlueprint.name: The Kestrel
shipBlueprint.desc: Can't go wrong with the classics! This is the earliest rendition of this version of the Alpha Kestrel (recreated with a few liberties). It cannot support AE systems, so be careful you don't waste your scrap on them at stores!
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock every vanilla cruiser layout.

shipBlueprint.name: 7 Sins
shipBlueprint.unlock: Prove the extent of your frivolous wealth by investing in one of the many bad decisions one can make in the Multiverse to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Whoever authorized the crew of this vessel to be entirely Lanius severely misunderstood the implications of their greed.

shipBlueprint.name: Loan Shark
shipBlueprint.unlock: Defeat the Debt Collector to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: Commissioned by LaRoache as his crowning jewel, this solid gold Leech ship might be dazzling, but it's also not really up to par for a military vessel.

shipBlueprint.name: Suprapedal
shipBlueprint.unlock: Unlock all variants of the Slug, Guild, Hacker, Knighted, Pleasure, and Coalition Cruisers to unlock this ship.
shipBlueprint.desc: After the last failure of Nights' attempt at a pleasure cruiser, he went full force with a complete redesign of a Pleasure Barge.
